clinical_study.brief_title: Early Socioemotional Intervention for Children With Autism Spectrum Disorder in Hong Kong and Mainland China
clinical_study.official_title: Early Socioemotional Intervention for Children With Autism Spectrum Disorder in Hong Kong and Mainland China

collaborator.agency: Guangdong Province, Department of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to develop a culturally-sensitive parent-training intervention to enhance socioemotional functioning of young children (aged 3-6) with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) in Mainland China. The investigators will conduct randomized controlled trials to evaluate the effectiveness and feasibility of this program in a pilot study and then a large-scale community-based study in Shenzhen, China, to examine the generalizability of the treatment outcomes of this intervention for Chinese children with ASD.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Autism Diagnostic Observation Schedule, Second Edition (ADOS-2)
primary_outcome.description: ADOS-2 is a diagnostic measure used in this study to assess the change in children's ASD symptoms

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the Autism Spectrum Quotient (AQ)
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-intervention, immediately after the intervention, and 4-month post-intervention
primary_outcome.description: AQ is a parent-report measure used in this study to measure change in children's ASD symptoms

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Dyadic Parent-Child Interaction Coding System (DPICS system)
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre-intervention, immediately after the intervention, and 4-month post-intervention
primary_outcome.description: The DPICS system is used in this study to measure the change in the quality of parent-child interaction through observations of dyads during free and structured play in the clinical setting and 5-minute parents' description of their children. The code categories include the number of command, praise, joint attention and verbal responsiveness, words used by parents and the intonation in their language.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Parenting Stress Index, Fourth Edition Short Form (PSI-4-SF)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-intervention, immediately after the intervention, and 4-month post-intervention
secondary_outcome.description: PSI-4-SF is a parent-report measure used in this study to measure change in parenting stress

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Self-Efficacy in Nurturing Role Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-intervention, immediately after the intervention, and 4-month post-intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Self-Efficacy in Nurturing Role Questionnaire is a parent-report measure used in this study to measure change in parents' self-efficacy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-intervention, immediately after the intervention, and 4-month post-intervention
secondary_outcome.description: COS is a teacher-report measure used in this study to measure children's social behaviours in classroom setting

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Social Responsiveness Scale, Second Edition (SRS-2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-intervention, immediately after the intervention, and 4-month post-intervention
secondary_outcome.description: SRS-2 is a teacher-report measure used in this study to measure children's social behaviours

arm_group.description: Participants in the ASD intervention group will receive training to help children improve socioemotional functioning.
Participants in this group will be placed on the wait list and receive the ASD intervention training 2 months after the other groups

intervention.description: A culturally sensitive intervention based on the "train the trainer (or coach the coach) model" for enhancing the social adaptive functioning of young children (aged 3-6) with ASD in China, via providing training for parents

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged 3-6
- Living in Shenzhen, Mainland China
- Diagnosed with ASD or suspected of having ASD

responsible_party.investigator_title: Vice-President and Pro-Vice-Chancellor (Academic Staffing and Resources)
